soFar.title: So Far

meta.title: So Far - Morris Liu
meta.description: Morris Liu's professional journey: 7 years from individual contributor to CTO. Experience building AI infrastructure, leading engineering teams, and creating open source tools like Sealbox and Kira.

soFar.description: I build software and lead teams. Currently working on AI infrastructure while side-building tools that solve real problems. This page captures the journey so far—the work, the projects, and the lessons learned.

work.title: Work
work.description: Seven years of growth from individual contributor to team leader. Each role taught me something different about technology, people, and the balance between moving fast and building things that last.

positions.title: Full-Stack Engineer
positions.description: Focused on AI infrastructure and scalability challenges. Working with a diverse team to solve complex distributed systems problems while maintaining startup agility.

positions.title: CTO
positions.description: Promoted to CTO as EverXYZ entered MiraclePlus (formerly YC China) accelerator program. Led a 20-person engineering team through rapid scaling, established sustainable development practices, and balanced technical debt with feature delivery. Learned that the hardest part of leadership isn't the technology—it's the people.

positions.title: Tech Lead & Team Manager
positions.description: Naturally evolved into leadership as the team grew from startup to scale-up. Discovered that good management amplifies everyone's capabilities, while bad management crushes even the best engineers. Built a culture of context not control.

positions.title: Full-Stack Engineer
positions.description: Joined as employee #4 to build a CAD platform from zero. The classic startup experience: wearing every hat, moving fast, breaking things, and occasionally building something users actually wanted. Learned that early-stage product development is 90% listening to users and 10% clever code.

positions.title: Frontend Engineer
positions.description: Developed data analytics modules and multi-store management systems for the established product. Built component libraries and solved complex browser compatibility issues—including that one IE9 fixed element rendering bug that haunted everyone.

positions.title: Intern
positions.description: Joined as an early team member when the Kemanman project was just forming. Implemented C-side membership card features, contributing to the foundation of what would become a key product.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: A mix of professional work and personal exploration. The work projects showcase technical leadership and architecture design, while open source projects reflect my curiosity and problem-solving approach.

items.title: X-Elephant: AI for Sales & Support
items.description: Led AI infrastructure design for sales and support automation platform.
details: RAG Optimization: Built Qdrant-based vector database cluster, developed custom Rust tools to reduce memory usage from 100GB+ to 10GB (90% reduction).
Data Pipeline: Automated Shopify data collection using Playwright and webhook-based real-time updates.

items.title: EverCraft: Version Control System for CAD Files
items.description: Built SaaS platform bringing Git-inspired version control to CAD workflows.
details: Architecture Design: Designed distributed storage system handling 10TB+ CAD files with version tracking and branching capabilities.
3D Visualization: Integrated fractal3D engine for real-time model preview and collaborative annotation across 20+ CAD formats.
Team Management: Led cross-functional development through product-market fit, serving 200+ engineering teams.

items.title: EverCraft Lite: Local CAD Version Control
items.description: Desktop solution incubated from EverCraft using Tauri and Rust.
details: Cross-Platform Development: Built native desktop app with Tauri, achieving 90% code reuse between Windows/macOS/Linux.
Performance Optimization: Implemented efficient file watching and diff algorithms, reducing memory usage by 70% compared to web version.
User Experience: Designed intuitive graphical version control interface serving 500+ individual engineers and small teams.

items.title: fractal3D: 3D CAD Visualization Engine
items.description: Built online 3D CAD visualization engine with low-code capabilities.
details: Team Leadership: Led 5-person engineering team through complete product lifecycle from concept to 10,000+ monthly active users.
Technical Innovation: Developed WebGL-based rendering engine supporting 20+ CAD formats with loading within seconds for 100MB+ models.
Product Strategy: Transformed complex 3D technology into accessible SaaS platform.

items.title: Sealbox
items.description: A lightweight secret management service built with Rust. Single binary, SQLite storage, end-to-end encryption—designed for developers who want secure secret storage without enterprise complexity. Perfect for CI/CD, containers, and small teams.

items.title: openrouter-rs
items.description: Type-safe Rust SDK for OpenRouter.ai with async support and builder patterns. Leverages Rust's type system to make LLM API interactions predictable and memory-safe, supporting everything from simple completions to streaming responses.

items.title: funcall
items.description: A lightweight Rust library that transforms regular functions into dynamically callable JSON tools with a single `#[funcall]` macro. Minimal boilerplate, type-safe serialization, and runtime function invocation by name.

items.title: Kira
items.description: An AI assistant that captures context from everything you do—selected text, clipboard, files, conversations—then uses that rich context to help you develop and connect your ideas. Built for people who think better through conversation than traditional note-taking tools.

side.title: Side
side.bass: I spend time practicing bass, working through the grooves that shaped music—{queen}'s theatrical bass lines, {chic}'s infectious funk, {ewf}'s sophisticated arrangements, and {acdc}'s relentless drive. There's something about the bass that mirrors good engineering: it's the foundation that holds everything else together.
side.photography: When I'm not playing music, I'm often capturing moments through photography. I'm drawn to the philosophy of photographers like {cartierBresson}, who taught us about the decisive moment, and {hideakiHamada}, whose quiet observations of daily life reveal extraordinary beauty in the ordinary.
side.philosophy: Both photography and music have shaped how I think about code. Like a good composition or a perfectly timed shot, the best software feels inevitable once you experience it. I believe in building things that last, writing code that others can understand, and finding the rhythm that makes complex systems feel simple.
